titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan, Yale University, Records
Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 17, 2019 at 08:18

did.unittitle: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of conference materials documenting the Yale Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan (MEChA), African American Studies, the Black Student Alliance at Yale, and a study documenting conferences on AIDS and HIV infections.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan (New Haven, Conn.)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies, and organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan, Yale University, Records (RU 79). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan (MEChA) was founded in 1968 as Los Hermanos and changed its name to United Mexican American Students (UMAS) when Yale College started admitting women in 1969. Later in 1969, the group changed their name to its current form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of conference materials documenting the Yale Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan (MEChA), African American Studies, the Black Student Alliance at Yale, and a study documenting conferences on AIDS and HIV infections.

controlaccess.subject: College students -- Societies, etc.
Mexican American students -- Societies, etc.
controlaccess.corpname: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlan (New Haven, Conn.)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 3 and 4 are open for research. The remainder of the accession is restricted until January 1, 2023.
